Description: St Christopher, design for a stained glass roundel; the hermit, St Antony, seated at the entrance of a cave, with a lamp in his hand and a crucifix before him, to right a bell and in the landscape beyond, St Christopher carrying the Christ Child across a river. 1542 Pen and black ink
Dimensions: Width: 250 millimetres (circular, top and bottom cut)
Curator's comments: Acquired under the name of Cranach. Transferred to Pieter Cornelisz. Kunst by A E Popham on the basis of comparison with a companion drawing of the Temptation of Christ with the date 1542 at Stockholm.
Bibliographic references: Popham (D & F) 1932 / Dutch and Flemish drawings of the XV and XVI centuries (4)
Exhibition history: 1995 Jan-Mar, Southampton Gallery, 'Drawing the Line', no. 42 1995 Mar-Apr, Manchester Gallery, 'Drawing the Line', no. 42
Associated names: Representation of: St Antony of Egypt
